result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kelly Ann Kojis

records.addlTxt:
Deputy District Attorney Caleb Saunders appears on behalf of the State. Attorney Michael T Crosby and Kelly Ann Kojis appear in custody via Zoom. Defense requests signature bond. State objects. Court orders $1,000.00 signature bond with same prior conditions. Court allows defendant to have telephone contact with MK. All other conditions remain.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Defendant to have no contact with MAK or their residence or place of employment. Court allows telephone contact only with MAK.
Absolute sobriety.

Deputy District Attorney Caleb Saunders appears on behalf of the State. Attorney Michael T Crosby in court. Kelly Ann Kojis appears in custody via Zoom. Present bond continued
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 14, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Kelly Ann Kojis appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Michael T Crosby appeared by video for Kelly Ann Kojis.  Prosecuting attorney Kevin Charles Greene in court for the State of Wisconsin.
Status hearing scheduled for September 23, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
Prosecuting attorney Kevin L Steuck in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Kelly Ann Kojis in court, in custody.  Attorney Michael T Crosby in court for Kelly Ann Kojis. 
Defendant enters not guilty pleas to all counts. 
Present bond continued
Final pre-trial scheduled for August 22, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant to have no contact with MAK or their residence or place of employment.
Absolute sobriety.

Prosecuting attorney Natalie M. Mulvey in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Kelly Ann Kojis in court, in custody. All parties appear via zoom.
Defendant appears quite ill on zoom hearing. SPD to evaluate defendant.
Court finds good cause to exceed time limits.
Court finds probable cause.
Bond argument reserved.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 17, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
